-- This script was generated by a beta version of the ERD tool in pgAdmin 4.
-- Please log an issue at https://redmine.postgresql.org/projects/pgadmin4/issues/new if you find any bugs, including reproduction steps.
BEGIN;


CREATE TABLE public.activition_codes
(
    user_id integer NOT NULL,
    activition_code character varying(6) NOT NULL,
    confirm_situation boolean NOT NULL,
    PRIMARY KEY (user_id)
);

CREATE TABLE public.candidates
(
    user_id integer NOT NULL,
    first_name character varying(50) NOT NULL,
    last_name character varying(50) NOT NULL,
    tc_no character varying(11) NOT NULL,
    birth_date date NOT NULL,
    PRIMARY KEY (user_id)
);

CREATE TABLE public.employers
(
    user_id integer NOT NULL,
    company_name character varying(100) NOT NULL,
    web_adress character varying(100) NOT NULL,
    PRIMARY KEY (user_id)
);

CREATE TABLE public.job_titles
(
    id integer NOT NULL,
    job_name character varying(50) NOT NULL,
    PRIMARY KEY (id)
);

CREATE TABLE public.staff_users
(
    user_id integer NOT NULL,
    first_name character varying(50) NOT NULL,
    last_name character varying(50) NOT NULL,
    birth_date date NOT NULL,
    tc_no character varying(11) NOT NULL,
    "position" character varying(50) NOT NULL,
    PRIMARY KEY (user_id)
);

CREATE TABLE public.users
(
    id integer NOT NULL,
    email character(100) NOT NULL,
    password character(50) NOT NULL,
    PRIMARY KEY (id)
);

ALTER TABLE public.users
    ADD FOREIGN KEY (id)
    REFERENCES public.activition_codes (user_id)
    NOT VALID;


ALTER TABLE public.users
    ADD FOREIGN KEY (id)
    REFERENCES public.candidates (user_id)
    NOT VALID;


ALTER TABLE public.users
    ADD FOREIGN KEY (id)
    REFERENCES public.employers (user_id)
    NOT VALID;


ALTER TABLE public.users
    ADD FOREIGN KEY (id)
    REFERENCES public.staff_users (user_id)
    NOT VALID;

END;
